item.title: Wrapping up and going beyond the basics
item.description: Required This looks like a lot, but most of these are quite short. Keep in mind throughout all these readings that an “algorithm” in these contexts is typically some fancy type of regression model where the outcome variable is something binary like “Safe babysitter/unsafe babysitter,” “Gave up seat in past/didn’t give up seat in past”, or “Violated probation in past/didn’t violate probation in past”, and the explanatory variables are hundreds of pieces of data that might predict those outcomes (social media history, flight history, race, etc.

item.title: Science communication
item.description: Required (regression and inference) 11.1–11.3 in ModernDiveChester Ismay and Albert Y. Kim, ModernDive: An Introduction to Statistical and Data Sciences via R, 2018, https://moderndive.com/. 7.4 in OpenIntro StatisticsDavid M. Diez, Christopher D. Barr, and Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel, OpenIntro Statistics, 3rd ed., 2017, https://www.openintro.org/stat/textbook.php?stat_book=os. Take advantage of the accompanying video!
